title: URL Routing in React SPA with Gitub Pages
author: Masum Ahmed
description: Github pages doesn't support URL routing for single page applications out of the box. Here's jank workaround to get it working.
md: Github pages doesn't support URL routing for single page applications out of the box. This means that if you have a react app that uses react-router-dom to handle routing, you'll run into issues when you try to navigate to a route that isn't the root route. For example, if you have a route like `https://masumahmed.github.io/my-react-app/about`, you'll get a 404 error because github pages doesn't know how to handle that route.
The solution is to use a jank workaround to get URL routing working on github pages. Here's how you can do it:

The page you are looking for does not exist.

4. Run `npm run build` to build your react app.
5. Deploy your react app to github pages using the `gh-pages` package:

That's it! Your react app should now work with URL routing on github pages. You can test it by navigating to a route like `https://masumahmed.github.io/my-react-app/about` and it should work as expected.

title: Hello World
author: Masum Ahmed
description: My first post from my static site bloging system.
md: Hello world this is my new static site bloging system that i made. It's similar to jekyll but it's written in python. I'm using markdown to write my blog posts! Yippie!
I'm going to use this functionality of my website to do the following:
1. post solutions to difficult bugs and problems that i've solved in hopes that it will help others
2. post about my projects and what i'm working on
3. post about my thoughts and ideas on technology and programming
4. post about my life and what i'm doing as it relates to tech
